Situation1: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Expectation2: Provide initial medical care to patients
Situation2: The ambulance driver is responding to a patient with symptoms of a major heart attack
Story: I had promised her this weekend would be just for us. It was our last chance before she left for months, and I could see the hope in her eyes as we planned every detail. We sat together at the café, her hand in mine, when my radio crackled. A call came in—possible heart attack, minutes away. My training kicked in, the urgency of saving a life pressing on my chest. But then I looked at her, her smile faltering as she realized what the call meant. She needed me, too, just in a different way. I felt torn, the weight of my uniform and my love both heavy on my shoulders. I could hear the dispatcher’s voice, the expectation clear: someone’s life depended on me. But so did she, in this fleeting moment before everything changed. My heart pounded as I stood between the door and her, caught in the impossible space between duty and devotion, not knowing which way to turn.
